title: Olive oil consumption and risk of breast cancer: Prospective results from the Moli-sani Study, and a systematic review of observational studies and randomized clinical trials.
abstract: Breast cancer (BC) is the leading cause of cancer-related death among women worldwide. Olive oil, rich in monounsaturated fats and polyphenols, has been linked to a reduced BC risk, but epidemiological evidence remains limited. This study examined the association between olive oil consumption and BC risk in a large cohort of adult Italian women and conducted a systematic review on this association.
